page.title: 17TREES AT CARVERS ROCKS
page.content: At Carvers Rocks there is an old wood about three hundred years old on one side of the reservoir and a new part that is fifty years old on the other side. In the new wood there are all{Silver Birch}trees. They can grow up to 24 metres high.{Silver Birches like to grow in damp soil. In the old wood there are all different types of trees. There are {Oak}trees,{Silver Birches, Rowan}trees and{Hazels.}Also we saw an{Aspen}which is related to the Poplar tree. It makes a shivering sound. It was growing next to a{Mountain Ash}or {Rowan.}It is very rare in South Derbyshire. The{Hazel}is normally a small tree but it can become quite big. In Carvers Rocks there were lots of shells on the floor. They had been eaten by mice, squirrels or birds.
